page.title: 05Agriculture.
page.content: The land use of the square is predominantly agricultural. This is a mixed farming area. The most common type of farm is arable mostly cereals and rape,but there are also significant numbers of livestock both dairy and beef cattle as well as sheep.To this extent the area is unusual for a County in which arable farming predominates. Close to the river in the west of the square,there are well established hedgerows and the fields are smaller than in the eastern section. There has been considerable mechanisation and de-manning in recent years.All basic crop growing cultivation and harvesting is now done by machine.The one exception to this in the square is to be found on the market garden land close to Sharnbrook turn off the A6.
